intro: Psychotria surigaoensis, commonly known as the Surigao Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
